ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag

Class GameController

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ca.mcgill.ecse211.captureflag.GameController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class GameController
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class will implement the overall game logic that will follow according to our software flowchart

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                      EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                      EV3MediumRegulatedMotor zip,
                      Odometer odo,
                      LightLocalization li,
                      UltrasonicLocalization us,
                      LightPoller lp,
                      UltrasonicPoller usPoller,
                      Navigation nav,
                      ca.mcgill.ecse211.WiFiClient.WifiConnection conn,
                      FlagDetection flag)
        Constructor for the game controller, the class that runs all game logic.
        Parameters:
        rightMotor - Right motor object
        leftMotor - Left motor object
        zip - Top (pulley) motor object
        odo - Odometer object, keeps track of motor rotations
        li - Light localization object, used to determine accurate location based on grid lines
        us - Ultrasonic localization object, used to roughly orient the robot for initial light localization based on the corner walls
        lp - Light poller object used to get data from the rear downward-facing light sensor
        usPoller - Ultrasonic poller object, used to get data from the front ultrasonic sensor
        nav - Navigation object, used to turn and navigate to points
        conn - Wifi connection object, used to get the data from the server
        flag - Flag detection object, used to search the region that holds the flag and find the correct flag
        lp_flag - Light poller object used to get data from the front-facing light sensor

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        This method is the controller for all game logic. It gets data from the server and then runs through a set of tasks, the order of which depends on whether the robot is assigned to the red or green team.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • calculateSearchRegionPoint

        private void calculateSearchRegionPoint()
        Calculate the middle point of the search region. Depends on whether red team or green team and also the orientation of the search region.

      • getDataFromServer

        private void getDataFromServer()
        Obtains all game parameters from the server and assigns them to the appropriate variable. Game logic uses these variables to navigate to waypoints.
